Wouldn't such technology face a ton of resistance by ethics groups?[/bq]
More than likely.


I like "Conjoiners" cause essentially what basically happens is that all the smart people and people that accept cybernetics go travel space travel; what happens on earth is that people that follow the neo-luddity ideology, basically hippies and that think we should burn our computers and that, cause all the smart people leave their society collapses cause they no longer have anyone to make their stuff and then aliens wipe them out.

Personally I think there will be a point where anti-technology people just refuse to accept anymore technological advancement and as a result their societies go to shit cause they no longer have any smart people; like a modern day equivalent of the Amish, but cause they've never had to actually make their own farms they'll just starve to death.


Essentially say 2050:
Neo-luddites, "We hate how much society has rejected our morals!  We're going to hang out with hippies and grow our own food!  Growing food is easy!"
*You have died of dysentery*
